intro: Malleastrum contractum, commonly known as the narrowleaf malleastrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry climates.
